newsitem.title: LATVIA: Eight children die in Latvian firefighting show.
newsitem.headline: Eight children die in Latvian firefighting show.

text.p: Eight children plunged to their death on Saturday when a basket snapped from a crane during an exhibition of firefighting techniques in the Baltic state of Latvia, the interior ministry said.
At least 21 other people were injured, seven seriously, in the accident in the small town of Talsi, 100 km (60 miles) northwest of the capital Riga, a ministry spokesman said.
"Criminal negligence was involved and we will launch a criminal investigation...the people in charge let over 20 people climb into the basket, which was far too many," the spokesman said.

He added that the government planned to hold an extraordinary session on Sunday morning to examine the circumstances surrounding the accident in which the basket fell 20 metres (65 feet) as a crowd of around 1,000 watched in horror.
Much of the firefighting and rescue service equipment in the states of the former Soviet Union is old and worn out and cash-strapped local governments lack the funds to buy replacements.
